column8: PETALING JAYA: PAS has invited Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia to discuss seat distribution for the next general election, says Pribumi president Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin.He said this was the product of a meeting between Pribumi's Datuk Seri Mukhriz Mahathir and PAS' Datuk Tuan Ibrahim Tuan Man."We have received news that PAS is inviting us to discuss how to divide the seats," Muhyiddin told reporters at a press conference on Wednesday.He said that they would begin discussions on the matter shortly.Asked if Pribumi's ties with PAS would be affected by the current bad blood between the Islamist party and DAP, he said this would be a matter to be addressed later."Our aim is for Pribumi and PAS to reach a consensus."After that, we will take into account the issues and see if we can find a middle ground," said Muhyiddin.On the possibility of PAS and Parti Amanah Negara competing for the same seats, Muhyiddin said this was not an issue restricted to the two parties but affected Pakatan Harapan member parties as well.He said this was why discussions were important and hoped that the parties would stay focused on the bigger picture.
i thought the news came from PASlooks like Pribumi prematurely ejaculated
